com.tymeac.demo

Class TySvrComm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tymeac.demo.TySvrComm

  • public class TySvrComm
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Tymeac Server Communication Class used by Clients. This Class is not used by the Tymeac Server. You may make any changes for your installation. Constructor() is for use by all customer code. The Client Communication Methods are described in your documentation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      private static TyVariables TyV 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TySvrComm()
      This constructor is used by the Tymeac Client applications when a naming service look up is necessary.
      TySvrComm(TymeacInterface Ty)
      This constructor is used by the Tymeac Client applications when no naming look up is necessary.

      • doAlternate

        private void doAlternate(java.lang.String alt_name)
        This is the alternate communication procedure Although this Class and this method are your code, the functionality within this method is similar to the code with a private Tymeac communication Class. That Class is used by the Tymeac GUI and non-GUI Client Classes to communicate with the Tymeac Server. THEREFORE, you may not alter the functionality of this method. You may certainly do anything in any order. However, it all must come down to invoking this method: "getTymeacInterface" and returning this object: "TymeacInterface" on an instance of your Alternate.class: "obj" (TymeacInterface) meth.invoke(obj, null); When you make changes to your Alternate.class, you should also make sure the Tymeac GUI Classes work. Run the main Tymeac GUI Class, TyMenu. Choose various windows within to make sure all is well.
        Parameters:
        alt_name - String Class name

      • doIIOP

        private void doIIOP()
        The variable needed for the CosNaming server is the Tymeac_IIOP name. This comes from the Tymeac Variables Class.

      • doRMI

        private void doRMI()
        The variables needed for RMI are the local URL name and the Tymeac name. These come from the Tymeac Variables Class. You may use this to set a security manager.

      • shutRequest

        public java.lang.String shutRequest()
        This is the Shut Down Request method for client applications. The return code is: ( Tymeac SD(xxxx) ) When the code, xxxx, is zero, Tymeac is fully shut down. When other, consult the documentation. Usually, threads are still active. Just rerun this method.
        Returns:
        java.lang.String

      • shutRequest

        public java.lang.String shutRequest(boolean force)
        This is the Shut Down Request method for client applications with a force indicator. The return code is: ( Tymeac SD(xxxx) ) When the code, xxxx, is zero, Tymeac is fully shut down. When other, consult the documentation. Usually, threads are still active. Just rerun this method.
        Returns:
        java.lang.String

      • syncRequest

        public java.lang.Object[] syncRequest(TymeacParm TP)
        This is the Synchronous Request method for client applications.
        Parameters:
        TP - TymeacMOParm
        Returns:
        Object
